intro: Polygonum dregeanum, commonly known as the Cape knotweed, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive arrow-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with upright stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and often have a reddish or purple hue, especially along the veins. Polygonum dregeanum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
